quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.name: Viswanathan Anand

quotes.text: Never in the history of chess have so many moves been repeated so often so quickly by so many people who didn't really understand them.
quotes.name: Michael Stean

quotes.text: Could we look into the head of a chess player, we should see there a whole world of feelings, images, ideas, emotion and passion.
quotes.name: Alfred Binet

quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.name: Alexander Pushkin

quotes.name: Pal Benko

quotes.name: Roman Dzindzichashvili

quotes.name: Khalifman

quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.name: Anatoly Karpov

quotes.text: Look at the catastrophic record Vishy Anand has against Garry Kasparov. quotes.name: Vladimir Kramnik

quotes.name: W.C. Fields

quotes.name: Ken Rogoff, 2010

quotes.text: Utter Crap  (review in Kingpin magazine of 'Unorthodox Openings' by Eric Schiller)
quotes.name: Tony Miles

quotes.name: Victor Kortchnoi

quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.name: C.J.S. Purdy

quotes.name: Humpy Koneru

My goal is to win the World Chess Championship; to beat the Russians. I take this very seriously.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: As Rousseau could not compose without his cat beside him, so I cannot play chess without my king's bishop. In its absence the game to me is lifeless and void. The vitalizing factor is missing, and I can devise no plan of attack.
quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.text: The computer age has arrived, and it influences everything: analysis, preparation, information. Now a different talent is required - the ability to synthesize ideas.
quotes.name: Boris Spassky

quotes.name: Hindu proverb

quotes.name: Aaron Nimzowitsch

quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.name: Samuel Standige Boden

quotes.name: Aaron Nimzowitsch

quotes.name: Anatoly Karpov

quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.name: Leonid Shamkovich

quotes.name: Robt. Burton (1621)

quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: Be well enough prepared that preparation won't play a role.
quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: In the endgame, the most common errors, besides those resulting from ignorance of theory, are caused by either impatience, complacency, exhaustion, or all of the above.
quotes.name: Pal Benko

quotes.text: Pawns are born free, yet they are everywhere in chains.
quotes.name: Rick Kennedy

quotes.name: Vasily Smyslov

quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: Inexperienced players have a fear of this piece, which seems to them enigmatic, mysterious, and astonishing in its power. We must admit that it has remarkable characteristics which compel respect and occasionally surprise the most wary players.
quotes.name: Eugene Znosko-Borowski

quotes.name: Judit Polgar

quotes.text: I ... have two vocations: chess and engineering. If I played chess only, I believe that my success would not have been significantly greater. I can play chess well only when I have fully convalesced from chess and when the 'hunger for chess' once more awakens within me.
quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.text: I like the moment when I break a man's ego.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.name: Neil McDonald

quotes.name: Edmar Mednis

quotes.text: I repeat, that the first and main difficulty in making a positional exchange sacrifice is a psychological caution: after all, you have to give up a rook for a minor piece. Therefore you must anticipate beforehand, in good time, how events will develop and take the necessary measures.
quotes.name: Tigran Petrosian

quotes.text: Confidence is very important - even pretending to be confident. If you make a mistake but do not let your opponent see what you are thinking then he may overlook the mistake.
quotes.name: Viswanathan Anand

quotes.name: Michael Basman

quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.name: Edmar Mednis

quotes.text: I cannot think that a player genuinely loving the game can get pleasure just from the number of points scored no matter how impressive the total. quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: The passion for playing chess is one of the most unaccountable in the world.
quotes.name: H.G. Wells

quotes.name: Peter Leko

quotes.name: Assiac

quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Chess is a meritocracy.
quotes.name: Lawrence Day

quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.text: The king is a strong piece - use it !
quotes.name: Rueben Fine

quotes.name: Bernd Cafferty

quotes.name: Sergey Shipov

quotes.name: Savielly Tartakower

quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.name: Vladimir Nabokov

quotes.name: Mikhail Tal

quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.name: Bent Larsen

quotes.name: Marcel Duchamp

quotes.name: Viswanathan Anand

quotes.name: Bent Larsen

quotes.name: Vasily Smyslov

quotes.name: Neil McDonald (1998)

quotes.name: Samuel Reshevsky

quotes.name: Mikhail Tal

quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: It's little quirks like this that could make life difficult for a chess machine.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: One can say that in the last decades chess has become more of a sport than of a science. I see it from an artistic point of view.
quotes.name: Judit Polgar

quotes.text: Chess was Capablanca's mother tongue.
quotes.name: Reti

quotes.text: I'm not a materialistic person, in that, I don't suffer the lack or loss of money.  The absence of worldly goods I don't look back on. For chess is a way I can be as materialistic as I want without having to sell my soul
quotes.name: Jamie Walter Adams

quotes.text: If cunning alone were needed to excel, women would be the best chess players.
quotes.name: Adolf Albin

quotes.text: Chess is a cure for headaches.
quotes.name: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.text: Life like chess is about knowing to do the right move at the right time.
quotes.name: Kaleb Rivera

quotes.text: I like to make them squirm.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: It often happens that a player is so fond of his advantageous position that he is reluctant to transpose to a winning endgame.
quotes.name: Samuel Reshevsky

quotes.text: The chesse, of all games wherein is no bodily exercise, is mooste to be commended; for therein is right subtile engine, whereby the wytte is made more sharpe and remembrance quickened. And it is the more commendable and also more commodiouse if the players haue radde the moralization of the chesse, and whan they playe do think upon hit; whiche bokes be in englisshe. But they be very scarse, by cause fewe men do seeke in plaies for vertue or wisdome.
quotes.name: Sir Thomas Eliot 1531

quotes.text: The middlegame I repeat is chess itself, chess with all its possibilities, its attacks, defences, sacrifices, etc.
quotes.name: Eugene Znosko-Borovsky

quotes.text: Playing chess has many aspects that can be useful in everyday situations like planning, concentration and combinations. You learn to win but also to lose and to be creative.
quotes.name: Judit Polgar

quotes.text: In order to become a grandmaster class player whose understanding of chess is superior to the thousands of ordinary players, you have to develop within yourself a large number of qualities, the qualities of an artistic creator, a calculating practitioner, a cold calm competitor.
quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: There's never before been a chess player with such a thorough knowledge of the intricacies of the game and such an absolutely indomitable will to win. I think Bobby is the greatest player that ever lived.
quotes.name: Lisa Lane

quotes.text: Barcza is the most versatile player in the opening. He sometimes plays P-KKt3 on the first, sometimes on the second, sometimes on the third, and sometimes only on the fourth move.
quotes.name: reputedly stated by Harry Golombek

quotes.text: Chess is imagination.
quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.text: Those who say they understand chess, understand nothing.
quotes.name: Robert Hubner

quotes.text: Chess can never reach its height by following in the path of science ... Let us, therefore, make a new effort and with the help of our imagination turn the struggle of technique into a battle of ideas.
quotes.name: Jose Capablanca

quotes.text: I have added these principles to the law: get the knights into action before both bishops are developed.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: Pawn endings are to chess what putting is to golf.
quotes.name: Cecil Purdy

quotes.text: To find the best moves great Masters, with years of experience, engage in laborious research, and the moves thus found are blindly repeated by amateurs without any attempt to fathom their real meaning and how and why they stand in their context.
quotes.name: Eugene Znosko-Borovsky

quotes.text: All my games are real.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: ... Today many players, especially young ones, think that the older openings are so thoroughly analysed that nothing more can be tried. This is a serious mistake. The methods of positional play become deeper and finer each year. Being well acquainted with them it is possible even in openings which seem to be fully explored to find ways to create a real fight.
quotes.name: Tigran Petrosian

quotes.text: I had a toothache during the first game. In the second game I had a headache. In the third game it was an attack of rheumatism. In the fourth game, I wasn't feeling well. And in the fifth game? Well, must one have to win every game?
quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.text: The task of the positional player is systematically to accumulate slight advantages and try to convert temporary advantages into permanent ones, otherwise the player with the better position runs the risk of losing it.
quotes.name: Wilhelm Steinitz

quotes.text: Not infrequently ... the theoretical is a synonym of the stereotyped. For the 'theoretical' in chess is nothing more than that which can be found in the textbooks and to which players try to conform because they cannot think up anything better or equal, anything original.
quotes.name: Mikhail Chigorin

quotes.text: The infallible criterion by which to distinguish the true from the would-be strategist is the degree of originality of his conceptions. It makes little difference whether this originality is carried to excess, as was the case with Steinitz and Nimzowitsch.
quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.text: I will not hide the fact that I love to hear the spectators react after a sacrifice of a piece or pawn. I don't think that there is anything bad in such a feeling; no artist or musician is indifferent to the reactions of the public.
quotes.name: Mikhail Tal

quotes.text: What would chess be without silly mistakes?
quotes.name: Kurt Richter

quotes.text: A chess player never has a heart attack in a good position.
quotes.name: Bent Larsen

quotes.text: Life is a kind of chess, with struggle, competition, good and ill events.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Quiet moves often make a stronger impression than a wild combination with heavy sacrifices.
quotes.name: Mikhail Tal

quotes.text: If a mistake or an inaccuracy occurs, there is no need to assume 'all is lost' and mope - one must reorient oneself quickly, and find a new plan to fit the new situation.
quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.text: I love all positions. Give me a difficult positional game, I will play it. But totally won positions, I cannot stand them
quotes.name: Jan Hein Donner

quotes.text: When chess masters err, ordinary wood pushers tend to derive a measure of satisfaction, if not actual glee.
quotes.name: I.A. Horowitz

quotes.text: If there were a 1:1 ratio of women and men in the chess world I would agree that all tournaments should be integrated. But a lot of women feel alienated at these mixed events, so it's positive to have occasional all women's events.
quotes.name: Jennifer Shahade

quotes.text: Chess is a game sufficiently rich in meaning that it is easily capable of containing elements of both tragedy and comedy.
quotes.name: Luke McShane

quotes.text: When I was eleven, I just got good.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Fischer wanted to give the Russians a taste of their own medicine.
quotes.name: Larry Evans

quotes.text: The king pawn and the queen pawn are the only ones to be moved in the early part of the game.
quotes.name: Wilhelm Steinitz

quotes.text: Vanity should never tempt a player to engage in a combat at the risk of loss of health. It is bad enough to lose without the additional annoyance of paying doctors' bills.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: No fool can play chess, and only fools do.
quotes.name: German proverb

quotes.name: Jennifer Shahade

quotes.text: If you can play the first ten or fifteen moves in just as many minutes, you can be in a state of bliss for the rest of the game. If, on the other hand, Bronstein thinks for forty minutes about his first move, then time trouble is inevitable.
quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: I am still a victim of chess. It has all the beauty of art and much more. It cannot be commercialized. chess is much purer than art in its social position.
quotes.name: Marcel Duchamp

quotes.text: It's very important not to put pressure on a child. Make sure that she/he feels that whatever happens it's not the end of the world. If they cry after a loss that's normal, as adults also hate to lose. If they win a game you should make them feel very proud but make sure they know the next game will be another challenge.
quotes.name: Judit Polgar

quotes.text: The key to ultimate succcess is the determination to progress day by day.
quotes.name: Edmar Mednis

quotes.text: Concentrate on material gains. Whatever your opponent gives you take, unless you see a good reason not to.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Chess, like love, like music, has the power to make people happy.
quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.name: Aaron Nimzowitsch

quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.text: India and China are improving by leaps and bounds and it will be their chess players who will lead the revolution of the XXI century.
quotes.name: Judit Polgar

quotes.text: I started by just sitting by the chessboard exploring things. I didn't even have books at first, and I just played by myself. I learnt a lot from that, and I feel that it is a big reason why I now have a good intuitive understanding of chess.
quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.text: All chess masters have on occasion played a magnificent game and then lost it by a stupid mistake, perhaps in time pressure and it may perhaps seem unjust that all their beautiful ideas get no other recognition than a zero on the tournament table.
quotes.name: Bent Larsen

quotes.text: Bobby Fischer's current state of mind is indeed a tragedy. One of the worlds greatest chess players - the pride and sorrow of American chess.
quotes.name: Frank Brady

quotes.name: Savielly Tartakower

quotes.text: Blitz chess kills your ideas.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.name: Paul Morphy

quotes.name: Susan Polgar

quotes.text: One doesn't have to play well, it's enough to play better than your opponent.
quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.text: Be a harsh critic of your own wins.
quotes.name: Vasilios Kotronias

quotes.name: Bent Larsen

quotes.text: Real chessplayers think about chess more or less 24 hours a day. It is a passion and a fate that one has to live with - and it lasts a lifetime.
quotes.name: Simen Agdestein

quotes.text: The pawns are the soul of the game.
quotes.name: Francois Andre Danican Philidor

quotes.text: Man is a frivolous, a specious creature, and like a chess player, cares more for the process of attaining his goal than for the goal itself.
quotes.name: Fyodor  Dostoyevsky

quotes.text: The passion for playing chess is one of the most unaccountable in the world. It slaps the theory of natural selection in the face. It is the most absorbing of occupations. The least satisfying of desires. A nameless excrescence upon life. It annihilates a man. You have, let us say, a promising politician, a rising artist that you wish to destroy. Dagger or bomb are archaic and unreliable - but teach him, inoculate him with chess.
quotes.name: H.G. Wells

quotes.text: Few things are as psychologically brutal as chess.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.name: Samuel Reshevsky

quotes.name: Hans Ree

quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.name: Ruy Lopez

quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.name: Wilhelm Steinitz

quotes.name: Jose Capablanca

(2012)
quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.name: Frank Marshall

quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.name: Miguel Najdorf

quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.name: Rudolf Spielmann

quotes.name: Reuben Fine

quotes.name: Richard Reti

quotes.name: Marcel Duchamp

quotes.name: Richard Dawkins

quotes.name: Rueben Fine

quotes.name: Samuel Reshevsky

quotes.name: Jose Capablanca

quotes.name: Levon Aronian

quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.name: Mansiysk 2011)

quotes.text: Many have become chess masters, no one has become the master of chess.
quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.text: It is a curse upon man. There is no happiness in chess.
quotes.name: H.G. Wells

quotes.text: No other master has such a terrific will to win. At the board he radiates danger, and even the strongest opponents tend to freeze, like rabbits when they smell a panther. Even his weaknesses are dangerous.
quotes.name: Anonymous German Expert

quotes.text: Never make a good move too soon.
quotes.name: James Mason

quotes.text: If you don't win, it's not a great tragedy - the worst that happens is that you lose a game.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.name: Liu Wenzhe

quotes.text: Excellent ! I will still be in time for the ballet !
quotes.name: Jose Capablanca (upon defeating Ossip Bernstein in the famous 29 move exhibition game played in Moscow in 1914, before setting off to the Bolshoi Theatre in horse-drawn carriage)

quotes.text: The cherished dream of every chessplayer is to play a match with the World Champion. But here is the paradox: the closer you come to the realization of this goal, the less you think about it.
quotes.name: Mikhail Tal

quotes.text: Throughout my chess career I sought out new challenges, looking for things no one had done before.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: The best chess masters of every epoch have been closely linked with the values of the society in which they lived and worked. All the changes of a cultural, political, and psychological background are reflected in the style and ideas of their play.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: The number of 'unneccessary' errors that have been committed on move 41 are legion.
quotes.name: Edmar Mednis

quotes.text: If the defender is forced to give up the center, then every possible attack follows almost of itself.
quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.text: The scheme of a game is played on positional lines; the decision of it, as a rule, is effected by combinations.
quotes.name: Richard Reti

quotes.text: The most intelligent inspection of any number of fine paintings will not make the observer a painter, nor will listening to a number of operas make the hearer a musician, but good judges of music and painting may so be formed. quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: Though most people love to look at the games of the great attacking masters, some of the most successful players in history have been the quiet positional players. They slowly grind you down by taking away your space, tying up your pieces, and leaving you with virtually nothing to do !
quotes.name: Yasser Seirawan

quotes.text: Examine moves that smite! A good eye for smites is far more important than a knowledge of strategical principles.
quotes.name: Purdy

quotes.text: The pleasure to be derived from a chess combination lie in the feeling that a human mind is behind the game, dominating the inanimate pieces ... and giving them breath of life.
quotes.name: Richard Reti

quotes.text: Every chess master was once a beginner.
quotes.name: Irving Chernev

quotes.text: You have to accustom yourself to practical study at home, you have to devote time to studies, to the history of chess, the development of chess, of chess culture.
quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.text: It is one of the insights of modern players, and especially of the best ones, that one has to play the position itself, not some abstract idea of the position.
quotes.name: John Watson

quotes.text: In my opinion, the style of a player should not be formed under the influence of any single great master.
quotes.name: Vasily Smyslov

quotes.text: The truth is that my chess development was nothing out of the ordinary, and it proceeded probably at a pace no faster than others.
quotes.name: Anatoly Karpov

quotes.text: The 'classical' starting position is very harmonious and when you play the random version I felt the positions tend to lead to wing games. You are developing your bishops all the time and the battle becomes rather slow and consequently dynamism is lost. (on FischerRandom)
quotes.name: Helgi Olafsson

quotes.text: Boris Vasilievich was the only top-class player of his generation who played gambits regularly and without fear ... quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: In chess, at least, the brave inherit the earth.
quotes.name: Edmar Mednis

quotes.text: Without error there can be no brilliancy.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.name: Tim Harding

quotes.name: Justin Bieber

quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: The most powerful weapon in chess is to have the next move.
quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.text: Chess can help a child develop logical thinking, decision making, reasoning, and pattern recognition skills, which in turn can help math and verbal skills.
quotes.name: Susan Polgar

quotes.text: Chess opens and enriches your mind.
quotes.name: Saudin Robovic

quotes.text: I like to play against people who are alive :) - ( In response to the question: "Which of the great dead players would you like to play?")
quotes.name: Judit Polgar

quotes.text: He who takes the queen's Knight's pawn will sleep in the streets.
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.text: Look at Garry Kasparov. After he loses, invariably he wins the next game. He just kills the guy. That's something that we have to learn to be able to do.
quotes.name: Maurice Ashley

quotes.text: The pupil wants not so much to learn, as to learn how to learn.
quotes.name: Samuel Boden

quotes.text: The proponents of Steinitz' theory - Tarrasch and his supporters - tried to express Steinitz' teaching in the form of laconic rules, and as often happens in such cases, they went too far. The laconic tended to become dogmatic, and chess began to lose its freshness, originality and charm.
quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: The ability to work hard for days on end without losing focus is a talent. The ability to keep absorbing new information after many hours of study is a talent.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: My theory of a key-move was always to make it just the reverse of what a player in 999 out of 1000 could look for.
quotes.name: Sam Loyd

quotes.text: You will already have noticed how often Capablanca repeated moves, often returning to positions which he had had before. This is not lack of deciciveness or slowness, but the employment of a basic endgame principle which is 'Do not hurry'.
quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: By playing at chess then, we may learn: First: Foresight. Second: Circumspection. Third: Caution. And lastly, we learn by chess the habit of not being discouraged by present bad appearances in the state of our affairs, the habit of hoping for a favorable chance, and that of persevering in the secrets of resources.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: I believe in magic ... There is magic in the creative faculty such as great poets and philosophers conspicuously possess, and equally in the creative chessmaster.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: Go through detailed variations in your own time, think in a general way about the position in the opponent's time and you will soon find that you get into time trouble less often, that your games have more content to them, and that their general standard rises.
quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: Perhaps chess is the wrong game for the times. Poker is now everywhere, as amateurs dream of winning millions and being on television for playing a card game whose complexities can be detailed on a single piece of paper.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: It is said that an ounce of common sense can outweigh a ton of 'variations'.
quotes.name: Savielly Tartakower

quotes.text: The first great chess players, including the world champion, got by perfectly well without constant coaches.
quotes.name: Anatoly Karpov

quotes.text: Playing long games online just takes too much time. It's fun to play blitz once in a while, where you can rely more on your intuition, your instincts rather than pure calculation and analysis.
quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.text: Only play into a variation in which your opponent is strong if you have your own personal novelty ready!
quotes.name: Edmar Mednis

quotes.text: Never before and never since have I seen - and I cannot even imagine, such an amazing rapidity of chess thinking that Capablanca possessed in 1913-14. In blitz games he gave all the St. Petersburg players odds of five minutes to one - and he won.
quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.text: It is not a move, even the best move that you must seek, but a realizable plan.
quotes.name: Eugene Znosko-Borovsky

quotes.text: The chess world is obligated to organize a match between the champion of the world and the winner of this Carlsbad tournament - indeed, this is a moral obligation. If the world of chess should remain deaf to its obligation, on the other hand, it would amount to an absolutely unforgivable omission, carrying with it a heavy burden of guilt.  -  (upon finishing clear first ahead of Capablanca in Carlsbad 1929, where reigning world champion Alekhine did not participate)
quotes.name: Aaron Nimzowitsch

quotes.text: During a chess competition a chess master should be a combination of a beast of prey and a monk.
quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.text: The pawn move is a capital investment. Every one of the forty-eight should, from the beginning, be spent as if it were one of the last forty-eight apprehensive and responsible dollars between yourself and starvation.
quotes.name: William Ewart Napier

quotes.text: Those who think that it is easy to play chess are mistaken. During a game a player lives on his nerves, and at the same time he must be perfectly composed.
quotes.name: Victor Kortchnoi

quotes.text: I didn't picture myself as even a grandmaster, to say nothing of aspiring to the chess crown. This was not because I was timid - I wasn't - but because I simply lived in one world, and the grandmasters existed in a completely different one. People like that were not really even people, but like gods or mythical heroes.
quotes.name: Anatoly Karpov

quotes.text: Begone! Ignorant and impudent knight, not even in chess can a King be taken. - (reputedly stated to one of his knights in 1110 after he was nearly captured by enemy forces)
quotes.name: King Louis VI

quotes.text: It is rightly said that the most difficult thing in chess is winning a won position.
quotes.name: Vladimir Kramnik

quotes.text: It is better to follow out a plan consistently even if it isn't the best one than to play without a plan at all. The worst thing is to wander about aimlessly.
quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: I play way too much blitz chess. It rots the brain just as surely as alcohol.
quotes.name: Nigel Short

quotes.text: The aim was simple: to deprive Karpov of his favourite occupation - standing at the board, staring straight at his opponent. While I was wearing these glasses, all he could admire was his own reflection.
quotes.name: Viktor Kortchnoi

quotes.text: Naturally, the psychological susceptibility of a match participant is significantly higher than a participant in a tournament, since each game substantially changes the over-all position.
quotes.name: Mikhail Tal

quotes.text: Players who balk at playing one-minute chess are failing to see the whole picture. They shouldn't be worrying that they will make more mistakes - they should be rubbing their hands in glee at the thought of all the mistakes their opponents will make.
quotes.name: Hikaru Nakamura

quotes.text: You must take your opponent into a deep dark forest where 2+2=5, and the path leading out is only wide enough for one.
quotes.name: Mikhail Tal

quotes.text: No pawn exchanges, no file-opening, no attack.
quotes.name: Aaron Nimzowitsch

quotes.text: Yes, I have played a blitz game once. It was on a train, in 1929.
quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.text: It is no secret that any talented player must in his soul be an artist, and what could be dearer to his heart and soul than the victory of the subtle forces of reason over crude material strength! Probably everyone has his own reason for liking the King's Gambit, but my love for it can be seen in precisely those terms.
quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.text: Chess is a game which reflects most honor on human wit.
quotes.name: Voltaire

quotes.text: ... though combinations are without number, the number of ideas are limited.
quotes.name: Eugene Znosko-Borowski

quotes.text: If it is true that a player's style is his person, then everyone plays as he is intended to by nature. I am naturally cautious, and I altogether dislike situations which involve risk.
quotes.name: Tigran Petrosian

quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.text: Alekhine is a poet who creates a work of art out of something that would hardly inspire another man to send home a picture post card.
quotes.name: Max Euwe

quotes.text: Even in the heat of a middlegame battle the master still has to bear in mind the outlines of a possible future ending.
quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.name: Jennifer Shahade

quotes.text: The conflict between Black's activity and White's better structure is central to the modern approach to the King's Gambit.
quotes.name: Neil MacDonald

When you have someone who is always on your case and it's never good enough no matter how you win a game, it just brings you down, you lose confidence. And as a chess player you have to be confident, you have to believe in yourself.
quotes.name: Hikaru Nakamura

quotes.text: Try to play after your opponent has eaten or drunk freely.
quotes.name: Luis Ramirez de Lucena (c. 1465 - c.1530)

quotes.text: The attack and defence emanating from this classical opening produce some of the most beautiful chess it is possible to obtain. The Queen's Gambit possesses the merit of being the soundest of all the openings.
quotes.name: Frank Marshall

quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: By playing slowly during the early phases of a game I am able to grasp the basic requirements of each position. Then, despite being in time pressure, I have no difficulty in finding the best continuation. Incidentally, it is an odd fact that more often than not it is my opponent who gets the jitters when I am compelled to make these hurried moves.
quotes.name: Samuel Reshevsky

quotes.text: If you have made a mistake or committed an inaccuracy there is no need to become annoyed and to think that everything is lost. You have to reorientate yourself quickly and find a new plan in the new situation.
quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.name: Bent Larsen

quotes.name: Che Guevara

quotes.name: David Norwood

quotes.name: Aaron Nimzowitsch

quotes.text: The true sweetness of chess, if it can ever be called sweet, is to see a victory snatched, by some happy impertinence, out of the shadows of apparently irrevocable disaster.
quotes.name: H.G. Wells

quotes.name: Lev Polugaevsky

quotes.text: Modern chess is too concerned with things like pawn structure. Forget it, checkmate ends the game.
quotes.name: Nigel Short

quotes.text: Rating systems work perfectly for players who play only in round robin closed events. I think most of them are overrated. Organizers invite same people over and over because they have the same rating and their rating stays high.  -  after winning 1999 FIDE World Championship while ranked # 44 in the world
quotes.name: Alexander Khalifman

quotes.text: A knight ending is really a pawn ending.
quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: Intellectual activity is perhaps the greatest pleasure of life; chess is one of the forms of intellectual activity.
quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.name: Savielly Tartakower

quotes.text: When you have a World Champion in your smartphone, the myth of the superior brainpower of human chess champions has lost its power.
quotes.name: Hans Ree

quotes.text: If we are to elevate the game of chess to a popular sport, grandmasters must become gladiators, otherwise the game will languish on the periphery, a voice crying in the wilderness, condemned to live and die on a cold arctic shore. (2012)
quotes.name: Michael Basman

quotes.text: To my way of thinking, Troitzky has no peer among endgame composers; no one else has composed so many and such varied endings of the first rank.
quotes.name: Jose Capablanca

quotes.text: The king, which during the opening and middlegame stage is often a burden because it has to be defended, becomes in the endgame a very important and aggressive piece, and the beginner should realize this, and utilize his king as much as possible.
quotes.name: Jose Capablanca

quotes.text: You may learn much more from a game you lose than from a game you win. You will have to lose hundreds of games before becoming a good player.
quotes.name: Jose Raul Capablanca

quotes.text: In almost any position the boundless possibilities of chess enable a new or at least a little-studied continuation to be found.
quotes.name: Tigran Petrosian

quotes.name: Paul Keres

quotes.text: Ultimately, what separates a winner from a loser at the grandmaster level is the willingness to do the unthinkable. A brilliant strategy is, certainly, a matter of intelligence, but intelligence without audaciousness is not enough. Given the opportunity, I must have the guts to explode the game, to upend my opponent's thinking and, in so doing, unnerve him. So it is in business: One does not succeed by sticking to convention. When your opponent can easily anticipate every move you make, your strategy deteriorates and becomes commoditized.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: Chess is a great game. No matter how good one is, there is always somebody better. No matter how bad one is, there is always somebody worse.
quotes.name: I.A. Horowitz

quotes.text: Human affairs are like a chess game: only those who do not take it seriously can be called good players.
quotes.name: Hung Tzu Ch'eng

quotes.text: Place the board so that the sun is in your opponent's eyes.
quotes.name: Ruy Lopez de Segura (c 1530-1580)

quotes.text: A pawn, when separated from his fellows, will seldom or never make a fortune.
quotes.name: Francois-Andre Danican Philidor

quotes.text: Every move creates a weakness.
quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.text: The tactician knows what to do when there is something to do; whereas the strategian knows what to do when there is nothing to do.
quotes.name: Gerald Abrahams

quotes.text: Look at Garry Kasparov. After he loses, invariably he wins the next game. He just kills the next guy. That's something that we have to learn to be able to do.
quotes.name: Maurice Ashley

quotes.text: The power of hanging pawns is based precisely in their mobility, in their ability to create acute situations instantly.
quotes.name: Boris Spassky

quotes.text: Even the most distinguished players have in their careers experienced severe disappointments due to ignorance of the best lines or suspension of their own common sense.
quotes.name: Tigran Petrosian

quotes.text: It is always better to sacrifice your opponents' men.
quotes.name: Savielly Tartakower

quotes.text: No chess Grandmaster is normal; they only differ in the extent of their madness.
quotes.name: Viktor Korchnoi

quotes.text: But alas! Like many another consummation devoutly to be wished, the actual performance was a disappointing one. (on the long awaited Lasker-Capablanca match in 1921)
quotes.name: Fred Reinfeld

quotes.text: The king is a fighting piece. Use it!
quotes.name: Wilhelm Steinitz

quotes.text: In the perfect chess combination as in a first-rate short story, the whole plot and counter-plot should lead up to a striking finale, the interest not being allayed until the very last moment.
quotes.name: Yates and Winter

quotes.text: The biggest problem I see among people who want to excel in chess - and in business and life in general - is not trusting these instincts enough. Too often they rely on having all the information, which the forces them to a conclusion. This effectively reduces them to the role of a microprocessor ...
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: All chess players should have a hobby.
quotes.name: Savielly Tartakower

quotes.text: Many chess players were surprised when after the game, Fischer quietly explained: 'I had already analyzed this possibility' in a position which I thought was not possible to foresee from the opening.
quotes.name: Mikhail Tal

quotes.text: When everything on the board is clear it can be so difficult to conceal your thoughts from your opponent.
quotes.name: David Bronstein

quotes.text: The best way to learn endings, as well as openings, is from the games of the masters.
quotes.name: Jose Capablanca

quotes.text: Chess is mental torture.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: He who has a slight disadvantage plays more attentively, inventively and more boldly than his antagonist who either takes it easy or aspires after too much. Thus a slight disadvantage is very frequently seen to convert into a good, solid advantage.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: At this time Fischer is simply a level above all the best chessplayers in the world.
quotes.name: John Jacobs

quotes.text: No price is too great for the scalp of the enemy king.
quotes.name: Alexander Koblentz

quotes.text: Endings of one rook and pawns are about the most common sort of endings arising on the chess board. Yet though they do occur so often, few have mastered them thoroughly. They are often of a very difficult nature, and sometimes while apparently very simple they are in reality extremely intricate.
quotes.name: Jose Capablanca

quotes.text: If your opponent cannot do anything active, then don't rush the position; instead you should let him sit there, suffer, and beg you for a draw.
quotes.name: Jeremy Silman

quotes.text: The proper timing of an attacking plan is a difficult matter which places great strain on a player's nerves. Mastery of this art is required for success in the international arena, but perfect mastery eludes even the very best chessplayers!
quotes.name: Leonid Shamkovich

quotes.text: On the bright side, I no longer have any more pieces to lose.
quotes.name: John ~ZugAddict~ Chernoff

quotes.text: And I, dear reader, since this is the last game we shall share, must say au revoir, and hope that somehow, somewhere (as I now lie upon my death bed) we shall have fun once more together - even if only with a King's Gambit - out of love.
quotes.name: Tony Santasiere

quotes.text: Just as it is wrong to work on chess by studying only the first 10-15 moves, so it is wrong to play one and the same opening system, even though it be rich in variations and nuances.
quotes.name: Yefim Geller

quotes.text: An innovation need not be especially ingenious, but it must be well worked out.
quotes.name: Paul Keres

quotes.text: The technical phase can be boring because there is little opportunity for creavivity, for art. Boredom leads to complacency and mistakes.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: The hardest game to win is a won game.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: In order to improve your game, you must study the endgame before everything else, for whereas the endings can be studied and mastered by themselves, the middle game and the opening must be studied in relation to the endgame.
quotes.name: Jose Raul Capablanca

quotes.text: In the laboratory the gambits all test unfavorably, but the old rule wears well, that all gambits are sound over the board.
quotes.name: William Ewart Napier

quotes.text: It is dangerous to maintain equality at the cost of placing the pieces passively.
quotes.name: Anatoly Karpov

quotes.text: After a great deal of discussion in Soviet literature about the correct definition of a combination, it was decided that from the point of view of a methodical approach it was best to settle on this definition - A combination is a forced variation with a sacrifice.
quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: Typically, in the last round of open tournaments the level of play is markedly lower, the number of blunders higher.
quotes.name: Pal Benko

quotes.text: Chess is a bond of brotherhood amongst all lovers of the noble game, as perfect as free masonry. It is a leveller of rank - title, wealth, nationality, politics, religion - all are forgotten across the board.
quotes.name: Frederick Milne Edge

quotes.text: A sacrifice is best refuted by accepting it.
quotes.name: Wilhelm Steinitz

quotes.text: You are not a born CEO or investor or chess grandmaster. You will achieve greatness only through an enormous amount of hard work over many years. (In "What It Takes To Be Great" FORTUNE Oct. 30, 2006)
quotes.name: Geoffrey Colvin

quotes.text: In my own experience, the main benefits are often realized when the endgames you have studied never make it onto the board. Endgames often arise in variations, and it's important to develop a good 'feel' for which ones are likely to pose practical problems for the opponent. Likewise, the confidence to simplify into an inferior but tenable endgame safe in the knowledge that you know how to handle it is invaluable.
quotes.name: Luke McShane

quotes.text: You need not play well - just help your opponent to play badly.
quotes.name: Genrikh Chepukaitis

quotes.text: Analysis is a glittering opportunity for training: it is just here that capacity for work, perseverence and stamina are cultivated, and these qualities are, in truth, as necessary to a chess player as a marathon runner.
quotes.name: Lev Polugaevsky

quotes.text: In chess the rules are fixed and the outcome is unpredictable, whereas in Putin's Russia the rules are unpredictable and the outcome is fixed.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: My God, Bobby Fischer plays so simply.
quotes.name: Alexei Suetin

quotes.text: Along with my retirement from chess analytical work seems to have gone too.
quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.text: Chess is a contributor to net human unhappiness, since the pleasure of victory is greatly exceeded by the pain of defeat.
quotes.name: Bill Hartston

quotes.text: It is not possible to become a great player without having learned how to analyse deeply and accurately.
quotes.name: Mark Dvoretsky

quotes.text: Having good strategies in playing chess is often a good indication of being focused in life.
quotes.name: Martin Dansky

quotes.text: In complicated positions, Bobby Fischer hardly had to be afraid of anybody.
quotes.name: Paul Keres

quotes.text: Modern chess is too much concerned with things like pawn structure. Forget it, Checkmate ends the game.
quotes.name: Nigel Short

quotes.text: A Soviet diplomat, like a skilled chess player, does not expect his opposite number to give up something for nothing, not even a pawn.
quotes.name: Arthur H. Dean (advisor to US presidents, UN delegate)

quotes.text: It was an impressive achievement, of course, and a human achievement by the members of the IBM team, but Deep Blue was only intelligent the way your programmable alarm clock is intelligent. Not that losing to a $10 million alarm clock made me feel any better.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: Haste is never more dangerous than when you feel that victory is in your grasp.
quotes.name: Eugene Znosko-Borovsky

quotes.text: Chess is far too complex to be definitively solved with any technology we can conceive of today. quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: Morphy was probably the greatest genius of them all.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Atomic is just like regular chess, except you're exploding, everything's exploding, and you're in bullet hell.
quotes.name: Unihedron 0

quotes.text: Americans really don't know much about chess. But I think when I beat Spassky, that Americans will take a greater interest in chess. Americans like winners.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: No fantasy, however rich, no technique, however masterly, no penetration into the psychology of the opponent, however deep, can make a chess game a work of art, if these qualities do not lead to the main goal - the search for truth.
quotes.name: Vasily Smyslov

quotes.text: As long as my opponent has not yet castled, on each move I seek a pretext for an offensive. Even when I realize that the king is not in danger.
quotes.name: Mikhail Tal

quotes.text: Chess is thriving. There are ever less round robin tournaments and ever more World Champions.
quotes.name: Robert Huebner (1990, Schach)

quotes.text: GM Naiditsch reckoned that me playing the King's Indian against Anand was something akin to a samurai running at a machine gun with a sword.
quotes.name: Hikaru Nakamura

quotes.text: In 1996, the players at the VSB tournament in Amsterdam sent me a card for my wedding with this dedication, 'Anand congrats on your wedding. You were a great player, now be ready to lose 50 points'.
quotes.name: Viswanathan Anand

quotes.text: Even in the King's Gambit ... White is no longer trying to attack at all costs. He has had to adapt his approach and look for moves with a solid positional foundation
quotes.name: Neil McDonald  (1998)

quotes.text: I don't like politics especially in chess. All I want is promote chess 24/7.
quotes.name: Susan Polgar

quotes.text: Fischer, who may or may not be mad as a hatter, has every right to be horrified.
quotes.name: Jeremy Silman

quotes.text: The battle for the ultimate truth will never be won. And that's why chess is so fascinating.
quotes.name: Hans Kmoch

quotes.text: There wasn't any particular player I modeled my game after. I tried to learn from everyone and create my own style. I studied past players. Truth be told I never had a favorite player. It's just not my nature to go around idolizing people. I just go try to learn.
quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.text: I still hope to kill Fischer.
quotes.name: Boris Spassky

quotes.text: A sport, a struggle for results and a fight for prizes. I think that the discussion about 'chess is science or chess is art' is already inappropriate. The purpose of modern chess is to reach a result.
quotes.name: Alexander Morozevich

quotes.text: Chess is a matter of vanity.
quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.text: We should praise, rather, the courage of the player who, relying only on his intuition, plunges into a brilliant combination of which the issue does not appear to him too clear.
quotes.name: Eugene Znosko-Borowski

quotes.text: A bad day of chess is better than any good day at work.
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.text: Chess is a matter of delicate judgement, knowing when to punch and how to duck.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: The choice of opening, whether to aim for quiet or risky play, depends not only on the style of a player, but also on the disposition with which he sits down at the board.
quotes.name: Yefim Geller

quotes.name: Wilhelm Steinitz

quotes.text: Chess is a battle between your aversion to thinking and your aversion to losing.
quotes.name: Someone

quotes.name: Rashid Nezhmetdinov

quotes.name: Jan Timman

quotes.text: I guess a certain amount of temperament is expected of chess geniuses.
quotes.name: Ron Gross

quotes.name: Boris Spassky

quotes.name: Stanley Kubrick

quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: There is no better place for learning to work independently and to extend your horizon than in higher school.
quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.text: Tactics involve calculations that can tax the human brain, but when you boil them down, they are actually the simplest part of chess and are almost trivial compared to strategy.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: The majority of people imagine a chess master as being a townsman who passes his life in an atmosphere of smoke and play in cafes and clubs: a neurasthenic individual, whose nerves and brains are continually working at tension: a one-sided person who has given up his whole soul to chess.
quotes.name: Richard Reti

quotes.text: When your house is on fire, you can't be bothered with the neighbors. Or, as we say in chess, if your King is under attack, don't worry about losing a pawn on the queenside.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: Chess is something more than a game. It is an intellectual diversion which has certain artistic qualities and many scientific elements.
quotes.name: Jose Capablanca

quotes.text: I am trying to beat the guy sitting across from me and trying to choose the moves that are most unpleasant for him and his style.
quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.text: Whenever Black succeeds in assuming the initiative in maintaining it to a successful conclusion, the sporting spirit of the chess lover feels gratified, because it shows that the resources of the game are far from being exhausted.
quotes.name: Savielly Tartakower

quotes.text: Chess masters as well as chess computers deserve less reverence than the public accords them.
quotes.name: Eliot Hearst

quotes.text: The defensive power of a pinned piece is but imaginary.
quotes.name: Aaron Nimzowitsch

quotes.text: Psychologically, you have to have confidence in yourself and this confidence should be based on fact.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Chess is the touchstone of intellect.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.text: One of the advantages of playing the King's Gambit in modern times is that the average opponent knows little about the defense.
quotes.name: Tony Santasiere

quotes.text: There is only one thing Fischer does in chess without pleasure: to lose!
quotes.name: Boris Spassky

quotes.text: The pin is mightier than the sword.
quotes.name: Fred Reinfeld

quotes.text: For a game it is too serious, for seriousness too much of a game.
quotes.name: Moses Mendelssohn

quotes.text: Place the contents of the chess box in a hat, shake them up vigorously, pour them on the board from a height of two feet, and you get the style of Steinitz.
quotes.name: Henry E. Bird

quotes.text: Playing without a concurrent critical review of one's skills will simply get you nowhere.
quotes.name: Edmar Mednis

quotes.text: The process of making pieces in chess do something useful (whatever it may be) has received a special name: it is called the attack. The attack is that process by means of which you remove obstructions.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: Chess is like body-building. If you train every day, you stay in top shape. It is the same with your brain - chess is a matter of daily training.
quotes.name: Vladimir Kramnik

quotes.text: I don't believe in psychology. I believe in good moves.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Deschapelles became a first-rate player in three days, at the age of something like thirty. Nobody ever believed the statement, not even Deschapelles himself, although his biographer declares he had told the lie so often that he at last forgot the facts of the case.
quotes.name: Frederick Milne Edge

quotes.text: Can you imagine the relief it gives a mother when her child amuses herself quietly for hours on end?
quotes.name: Klara Polgar

quotes.text: Pawns; they are the soul of this game, they alone form the attack and defense.
quotes.name: Philidor

quotes.text: Chess is not for the faint-hearted; it absorbs a person entirely. To get to the bottom of this game, he has to give himself up into slavery. Chess is difficult, it demands work, serious reflection and zealous research.
quotes.name: Wilhelm Steinitz

quotes.text: Throughout chess history, great debates have raged about the pros and cons of hanging pawns. The debates are nonsense; the answer is cut and dried. If the pawns can be attacked and forced to move forward, they are weak. If they can be defended and remain where they are, they are strong.
quotes.name: Yasser Seirawan

quotes.text: Not all artists are chess players, but all chess players are artists.
quotes.name: Marcel Duchamp

quotes.text: When I started out playing chess as a kid I thought I should be world champion. As a kid you have no idea what that means and you only sort of picture it. It is hard to imagine that I waited all those years and it happened in a late stage of my career.
quotes.name: Viswanathan Anand

quotes.text: The knight is renowned for, among other things, its suitability as a blockader ... Because its strength lies in short-range operations it is not uncomfortable standing in a single spot for long periods, as the Bishop is.
quotes.name: Samuel Reshevsky

quotes.text: I am the best player in the world and I am here to prove it.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Chess is a beautiful mistress.
quotes.name: Bent Larsen

quotes.text: Having spent alarmingly large chunks of my life studying the white side of the Open Sicilian, I find myself asking, why did I bother?
quotes.name: Daniel King

quotes.text: How come the little things bother you when you are in a bad position? They don't bother you in good positions.
quotes.name: Yasser Seirawan

quotes.text: When you look at them, kneel down or crouch in such a way that you can look through the glass stright into their faces and look them in the eye. You will see human beings across the passage of time. They have remarkable quality. They speak to you. (on the Isle of Lewis Pieces)
quotes.name: British Museum curator Irving Finkel

quotes.text: I give 98 percent of my mental energy to chess.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Your only task in the opening is to reach a playable middlegame.
quotes.name: Lajos Portisch

quotes.text: I am acutely conscious, from vast experience in opens, that guys around, say 2100 or more can definitely play chess and that one often has to work very hard to beat them.
quotes.name: Nigel Short

quotes.text: When I start to play a game I try to forget about previous games and try to concentrate on this game. This game is now the most important to me. But of course I am not a computer and you cannot simply press a button, delete, and everything you want to forget disappears automatically. But if you want to play well, it's important to concentrate on the now.
quotes.name: Vassily Ivanchuk

quotes.text: The thing is, back then you didn't have this transfer of information, this influence of computers and databases. This meant that everything you needed to pick up, you needed to pick up from what happened around you, what happened at tournaments, what the strongest players were doing. You could rely on your talent. It was a fantastic time. You didn't need to learn a lot, you didn't need to prepare a lot; it was all natural. That's why I liked it so much.
quotes.name: Jan Timman

quotes.text: The Queen's Gambit is like a piece of dead fish kept overlong on ice.
quotes.name: Tony Santasiere

quotes.text: When you're good at something, you should continue to do it. Too many players have stopped at a relatively young age ...
quotes.name: Jan Timman

quotes.text: The King plays a most important part in the endgame, and gains in power and activity as the number of pieces on the board diminishes. Acting in eight different directions, he becomes, instead of the weakest piece, one of the most formidable units.
quotes.name: Eugene Znosko-Borowski

quotes.text: Has he some psychological antipathy to realism? I am no psychologist, and cannot say. The fact remains that Euwe commits the most inexplicable mistakes in thoroughly favorable positions, and that this weakness has consistently tarnished his record.
quotes.name: Hans Kmoch

quotes.text: Chess is not relaxing; it's stressful even if you win.
quotes.name: Jennifer Shahade

quotes.text: The stomach is an essential part of the chess master.
quotes.name: Bent Larsen

quotes.text: When I was preparing for one term's work in the Botvinnik school I had to spend a lot of time on king and pawn endings. So when I came to a tricky position in my own games I knew the winning method.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: The game of chess is not merely an idle amusement; several very valuable qualities of the mind are to be acquired and strengthened by it, so as to become habits ready on all occasions; for life is a kind of chess.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: I claim that nothing else is so effective in encouraging the growth of chess strength as such independent analysis, both of the games of the great players and your own.
quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.text: There came a time when I realized that the ability to defend was - for a good chess player - insufficient. You can't be dependent upon your opponent's will, but must try to impose your will on him.
quotes.name: Victor Kortchnoi

quotes.text: You sit at the board and suddenly your heart leaps. Your hand trembles to pick up the piece and move it.  But what chess teaches you is that you must sit there calmly and think about whether its really a good idea and whether there are other better ideas.
quotes.name: Stanley Kubrick

quotes.text: The fatal hour of this ancient game is approaching. In its modern form this game will soon die a drawing death - the inevitable victory of certainty and mechanization will leave its stamp on the fate of chess.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: You cannot play at chess if you are kind-hearted.
quotes.name: French proverb

quotes.text: These are not pieces, they are men! For any man to walk into the line of fire will be one less man in your army to fight for you. Value every troop and use him wisely, throw him not to the dogs as he is there to serve his king.
quotes.name: Jamie Walter Adams

quotes.text: You can't take the pawn because then the other will queen. Like wonder twin powers
quotes.name: John ~ZugAddict~ Chernoff

quotes.text: I give 98 percent of my mental energy to chess. Others give only 2 percent.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: How would these young players feel if their own coach would use the confidential analysis and information against them in important events like the Olympiad, World Cup, US Championship, or other major events? quotes.name: Susan Polgar

quotes.text: Contrary to many young colleagues I do believe that it makes sense to study the classics.
quotes.name: Magnus Carlsen

quotes.text: Those who know the marvels of chess and wonder why this game of all games does not enjoy greater popularity may also ask why Pepsi-Cola is consumed by more people than Chateau Lafite, or the Beatles are more familiar than Beethoven.
quotes.name: Gregor Piatigorsky

quotes.text: Furman astounded me with his chess depth, a depth which he revealed easily and naturally, as if all he were doing was establishing well-known truths.
quotes.name: Anatoly Karpov

quotes.name: Jennifer duBois

quotes.text: The turning point in my career came with the realization that Black should play to win instead of just steering for equality.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.name: Max Euwe

quotes.text: Chess demands total concentration.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.name: William Steinitz

quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.name: Vladimir Putin

quotes.name: Judit Polgar

quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.name: Jose Capablanca

quotes.text: Chess is a contest between two men which lends itself particularly to the conflicts surrounding aggression.
quotes.name: Rueben Fine

quotes.text: Do not permit yourself to fall in love with the end-game play to the exclusion of entire games. It is well to have the whole story of how it happened; the complete play, not the denouement only. Do not embrace the rag-time and vaudeville of chess.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: Weak points or holes in the opponent's position must be occupied by pieces, not pawns.
quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.text: Chess mastery essentially consists of analyzing.
quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.text: Chess never has been and never can be aught but a recreation. It should not be indulged in to the detriment of other and more serious avocations - should not absorb or engross the thoughts of those who worship at its shrine, but should be kept in the background, and restrained within its proper province. As a mere game, a relaxation from the severe pursuits of life, it is deserving of high commendation.
quotes.name: Paul Morphy

quotes.text: Chess is war over the board. The object is to crush the opponents mind.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Chess strength in general and chess strength in a specific match are by no means one and the same thing.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: Castle early and often.
quotes.name: Rob Sillars

quotes.text: The fact that a player is very short of time is to my mind, as little to be considered as an excuse as, for instance, the statement of the law-breaker that he was drunk at the time he committed the crime.
quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.text: The loss of my childhood was the price for becoming the youngest world champion in history. When you have to fight every day from a young age, your soul can be contaminated. I lost my childhood. I never really had it. I have to be careful not to become cruel, because I became a soldier too early.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: You know, comrade Pachman, I don't enjoy being a Minister, I would rather play chess like you, or make a revolution in Venezuela.
quotes.name: Che Guevara

quotes.text: By strictly observing Botvinnik's rule regarding the thorough analysis of one's own games, with the years I have come to realize that this provides the foundation for the continuous development of chess mastery.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: Chess strategy as such today is still in its diapers, despite Tarrasch's statement 'We live today in a beautiful time of progress in all fields'. Not even the slightest attempt has been made to explore and formulate the laws of chess strategy.
quotes.name: Aaron Nimzowitsch (1925)

quotes.text: Chess is ruthless: you've got to be prepared to kill people.
quotes.name: Nigel Short

quotes.text: Chess programs are our enemies, they destroy the romance of chess. They take away the beauty of the game. Everything can be calculated.
quotes.name: Levon Aronian

quotes.name: Siegbert Tarrasch

quotes.text: There can be no finer example of the inspiring powers of competition to shatter the status quo than Hungary's Judit Polgar.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: By the mid-1990s the number of people with some experience of using computers was many orders of magnitude greater than in the 1960s. In the Kasparov defeat they recognized that here was a great triumph for programmers, but not one that may compete with the human intelligence that helps us to lead our lives.
quotes.name: Igor Aleksander

quotes.text: Combinations with a queen sacrifice are among the most striking and memorable ...
quotes.name: Anatoly Karpov

quotes.name: Vladimir Nabokov

quotes.name: Michael Stean

quotes.text: Campo, as everyone in chess recognized, had a 2600 rating as a politician.  -  (on F.I.D.E. President Florencio Campomanes)
quotes.name: Raymond Keene

quotes.text: Chess is 99 percent tactics.
quotes.name: Teichmann

quotes.text: When the chess game is over, the pawn and the king go back to the same box.
quotes.name: Irish saying

quotes.text: The main line of the Yugoslav Attack has become just too vast for most players to study in depth, and anyone intending to venture into such tricky waters needs to have an intimate knowledge of all the hidden reefs.
quotes.name: John Nunn

quotes.text: Don't be afraid of losing, be afraid of playing a game and not learning something.
quotes.name: Dan Heisman

quotes.text: The knight has a very peculiar movement. He moves to the third square distant, in an oblique direction, first through the adjoining square either way, and then to the next adjoining square either way again, entering into the one diagonally, and into the other sideways, and his move is always onto a square of a different colour from that which he previously occupied.
quotes.name: (from: Chess & Draughts Made Easy c 1860)

quotes.text: The process of rating players can be compared to the measurement of the position of a cork bobbing up and down on the surface of agitated water with a yard stick tied to a rope and which is swaying in the wind.
quotes.name: Arpad Elo

quotes.text: When I ask President Marcos for two million dollars, at worst he wants to know whether he should bring the money straight away or whether I can wait for a cheque in the post.
quotes.name: Florencio Campomanes

quotes.text: Do not bring your Queen out too early.
quotes.name: from Francisco Bernardina Calogno's poem 'On the Game of Chess' ('De ludo scachorum') circa 1500

quotes.text: The passed Pawn is a criminal, who should be kept under lock and key. Mild measures, such as police surveillance are not sufficient.
quotes.name: Aaron Nimzowitsch

quotes.text: You know you're going to lose. Even when I was ahead I knew I was going to lose  --on playing against Fischer.
quotes.name: Andrew Soltis

quotes.text: Chess: It's like alcohol. It's a drug. I have to control it, or it could overwhelm me.
quotes.name: Charles Krauthammer

quotes.text: When asked, "How is that you pick better moves than your opponents?", I responded: "I'm very glad you asked that, because, as it happens, there is a very simple answer. I think up my own moves, and I make my opponent think up his".
quotes.name: Alexander Alekhine

quotes.text: When a chess player looks at the board, he does not see a static mosaic, a 'still life', but a magnetic field of forces, charged with energy - as Faraday saw the stresses surrounding magnets and currents as curves in space; or as Van Gogh saw vortices in the skies of Provence.
quotes.name: Arthur Koestler

quotes.text: When Marx got into a difficult position he would get angry and losing a game would cause him to fly into a rage.  (on Karl Marx)
quotes.name: Wilhelm Liebknecht

quotes.text: Chess, like love, is infectious at any age.
quotes.name: Salo Flohr

quotes.text: Do not pick a move from a list of computer lines - use your own brains. This is important, especially for young players. It's better to study a worse line well than to reproduce a better computer line.
quotes.name: Laszlo Hazai

quotes.text: You must not let your opponent know how you feel.
quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: Chess, like any creative activity, can exist only through the combined efforts of those who have creative talent, and those who have the ability to organize their creative work.
quotes.name: Mikhail Botvinnik

quotes.text: Come on Harry!
quotes.name: Simon Williams

quotes.text: Chess players, people who travel all over the world, should be trusted or else not sent anywhere at all. Why are these four people (Antoshion and three other official 'minders') sent along to supervise us? With their meagre experience, all that thay did was interfere, more than ever before. And when they were needed, they weren't to be found ...
quotes.name: Victor Kortchnoi

quotes.text: Different people feel differently about resigning.
quotes.name: Bobby Fischer

quotes.text: Attackers may sometimes regret bad moves, but it is much worse to forever regret an opportunity you allowed to pass you by.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: With each success the ability to change is reduced. My longtime friend and coach, Grandmaster Yuri Dokhoian, aptly compared it to being dipped in bronze. Each victory added another coat.
quotes.name: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: Chess is 99% tactics.
quotes.name: Rudolph Teichmann

quotes.text: Truth derives its strength not so much from itself as from the brilliant contrast it makes with what is only apparently true. This applies especially to chess, where it is often found that the profoundest moves do not much startle the imagination.
quotes.name: Emanuel Lasker

quotes.text: The fact that the 7 hours time control allows us to play a great deep game is not of great importance for mass-media.
quotes.name: Alexei Shirov

quotes.text: When men lose against me, they always have a headache ... or things of that kind. I have never beaten a completely healthy man!
quotes.name: Susan Polgar

quotes.text: To have a knight planted in your game at K6 is worse than a rusty nail in your knee.
quotes.name: Efim Bogolubow

quotes.text: The only thing chess players have in common is chess.
quotes.name: Lodewijk Prins

quotes.text: The young people have read my book. Now I have no chance.
quotes.name: Efim Bogolubow

quotes.name: Edmar Mednis

quotes.text: Training in analysis (like any other form of chess training) should be treated very seriously.
quotes.name: Mark Dvoretsky

quotes.text: Under no circumstances should you play fast if you have a winning position. Forget the clock, use all your time and make good moves.
quotes.name: Pal Benko

quotes.text: When you have finished analysing all the variations and gone along all the branches of the tree of analysis you must first of all write the move down on your score sheet, before you play it.
quotes.name: Alexander Kotov

quotes.text: People who want to improve should take their defeats as lessons, and endeavor to learn what to avoid in the future. You must also have the courage of your convictions. If you think your move is good, make it.
quotes.name: Jose Capablanca
